GT.content: is madness the movement of the circle or its excess? besieges reason at its 2 borders (inside & outside)
GT.linkedContent: is madness the movement of the circle or its excess? besieges reason at its 2 borders (inside & outside)

GT.content: linked to double bind (stricture, ligature, obligation) > absolve, forget absolutely & forgive by giving (lier et délier absolument)
GT.linkedContent: linked to double bind (stricture, ligature, obligation) > absolve, forget absolutely & forgive by giving (lier et délier absolument)

GT.content: madness linked to double bind as the bind & the non-bind or débandade: folie de la garde ou de la capitalisation hypermnésique, et folie de la dépense oublieuse; eats away at language, burns up word or meaning of “gift,” spreads its ashes w/out return; that which does not return to the father
GT.linkedContent: madness linked to double bind as the bind & the non-bind or débandade: folie de la garde ou de la capitalisation hypermnésique, et folie de la dépense oublieuse; eats away at language, burns up word or meaning of “gift,” spreads its ashes w/out return; that which does not return to the father

R.content: figure of renvoi (remission, sending off, deferral) is like differance, trace, it creates spacing, and brings autoimmune in line with aporia, double bind
R.linkedContent: figure of renvoi (remission, sending off, deferral) is like differance, trace, it creates spacing, and brings autoimmune in line with aporia, double bind

R.content: Derrida does not acknowledge a political turn or ethical turn [in his work]: thinking of differance always political, contour & limits of political, around enigma or autoimmune double bind of the democratic (not certain democracy a political thought through & through)
R.linkedContent: Derrida does not acknowledge a political turn or ethical turn [in his work]: thinking of differance always political, contour & limits of political, around enigma or autoimmune double bind of the democratic (not certain democracy a political thought through & through)

R.content: [quoted in KH] democratic double injunction (around edges of khōra): 1) all-inclusive 2) secret entrusted to those worthy of it > paradox of example, good example
R.linkedContent: [quoted in KH] democratic double injunction (around edges of khōra): 1) all-inclusive 2) secret entrusted to those worthy of it > paradox of example, good example

R.content: event (im-possible) announces itself in the form of an injunction (comes from on high)
R.linkedContent: event (im-possible) announces itself in the form of an injunction (comes from on high)

R.content: never leaves me in peace, can’t put off until later
R.linkedContent: never leaves me in peace, can’t put off until later

R.content: “to” of “to-come” wavers btwn: imperative injunction (call or performative) and patient perhaps of messiancity (nonperformative exposure)
R.linkedContent: “to” of “to-come” wavers btwn: imperative injunction (call or performative) and patient perhaps of messiancity (nonperformative exposure)

R.content: the two haunt each other, are each other’s alibis, withdrawing into the secret of irony, of which democracy gives the right: to fiction and literature
R.linkedContent: the two haunt each other, are each other’s alibis, withdrawing into the secret of irony, of which democracy gives the right: to fiction and literature

FK.content: “religion” involved in reacting antagonistically, re-affirmatively outbidding itself > in this place knowledge & faith bound to each other by band of their opposition
FK.linkedContent: “religion” involved in reacting antagonistically, re-affirmatively outbidding itself > in this place knowledge & faith bound to each other by band of their opposition

FK.content: religion as ellipsis of sacrifice, Heidegger sees ontotheology as free from sacrifice & prayer, but Derrida sees double bind, religion excluding & requiring sacrifice, indemnification of unscathed, auto-immunization & sacrifice of sacrifice
FK.linkedContent: religion as ellipsis of sacrifice, Heidegger sees ontotheology as free from sacrifice & prayer, but Derrida sees double bind, religion excluding & requiring sacrifice, indemnification of unscathed, auto-immunization & sacrifice of sacrifice

BL.content: law is interdit (prohibition, prohibited): terrifying double bind of its own taking place
BL.linkedContent: law is interdit (prohibition, prohibited): terrifying double bind of its own taking place

LOBL.content: infinite violence [of what’s strictly called] “double bind,” double invagination, double obligation, double demand > sans arrêt and arrêt de mort, no reconciliation
LOBL.linkedContent: infinite violence [of what’s strictly called] “double bind,” double invagination, double obligation, double demand > sans arrêt and arrêt de mort, no reconciliation

LOBL.content: hymen, double bind, double affirmation, yes, yes, come, come [re: Blanchot’s 2 ghostly fiancées in L’arrêt de mort] signifies, desires, arrête life death
LOBL.linkedContent: hymen, double bind, double affirmation, yes, yes, come, come [re: Blanchot’s 2 ghostly fiancées in L’arrêt de mort] signifies, desires, arrête life death

LOBL.content: hymen is a “double bind” because each of these bonds that bind is [?], in itself, double
LOBL.linkedContent: hymen is a “double bind” because each of these bonds that bind is [?], in itself, double

LOBL.content: “and” as arrêt de mort, “and” of double bind, and I say “come,” “and immediately"-writing, annihilates time in ring of eternal return, yokes affirmation to itself in récit, the being-at-the-same-time of the other beyond time
LOBL.linkedContent: “and” as arrêt de mort, “and” of double bind, and I say “come,” “and immediately"-writing, annihilates time in ring of eternal return, yokes affirmation to itself in récit, the being-at-the-same-time of the other beyond time

POO.content: impossible to respond, impossible not to respond, double bind, 2 hands nailed down [no choice]
POO.linkedContent: impossible to respond, impossible not to respond, double bind, 2 hands nailed down [no choice]

POO.content: brought to a halt [arrêt?] when faced w/ contradictory orders
POO.linkedContent: brought to a halt [arrêt?] when faced w/ contradictory orders

SPOM.content: capital contradiction, at origin of capital: induces the “pragmatic” double constraint of all injunctions [see POO p. 143n difference btwn “use” & “mention”]
SPOM.linkedContent: capital contradiction, at origin of capital: induces the “pragmatic” double constraint of all injunctions [see POO p. 143n difference btwn “use” & “mention”]

SPOM.content: table dances spontaneously, autonomously, but it moves others too
SPOM.linkedContent: table dances spontaneously, autonomously, but it moves others too

SPOM.content: not just contradiction of sensuous non-sensuous in same Thing, but contradiction of automatic autonomy (spontaneity) > on stage of market, table (commodity) is a prosthesis of itself
SPOM.linkedContent: not just contradiction of sensuous non-sensuous in same Thing, but contradiction of automatic autonomy (spontaneity) > on stage of market, table (commodity) is a prosthesis of itself

POOF.content: perhaps as non-dialectical passage from one to other that Aristotle can’t think, unable to endure contamination coming from what is beyond both antithetical values > Nietzsche: “Glaube an die Gegensatze der Werthe (faith in antithetical values)”
POOF.linkedContent: perhaps as non-dialectical passage from one to other that Aristotle can’t think, unable to endure contamination coming from what is beyond both antithetical values > Nietzsche: “Glaube an die Gegensatze der Werthe (faith in antithetical values)”

POOF.content: btwn concept/event a double bind occurs, imposes itself to be endured there, law of an aporia, undecidability, crucial disjunction btwn thinking & knowing: gift, invention
POOF.linkedContent: btwn concept/event a double bind occurs, imposes itself to be endured there, law of an aporia, undecidability, crucial disjunction btwn thinking & knowing: gift, invention

POOF.content: teleiopoesis carries w/in it an irresistible disavowal, fearing all the chance & threat of the perhaps?: the called converted to the repressed, friend into enemy
POOF.linkedContent: teleiopoesis carries w/in it an irresistible disavowal, fearing all the chance & threat of the perhaps?: the called converted to the repressed, friend into enemy

POOF.content: to renounce desire, must command the other to be free, to address the other qua other, command him to be capable of not answering, double bind [eg. don’t answer my phone call]
POOF.linkedContent: to renounce desire, must command the other to be free, to address the other qua other, command him to be capable of not answering, double bind [eg. don’t answer my phone call]

POOF.content: via Montaigne, law of secrecy placed above law of city, apolitical drive of friendship divides virtue or reason > double bind: 1) sovereign fraternity of secrecy btwn 2 w/out perjury 2) political secrecy of brotherhood begins w/ the 3rd, opens to perjury
POOF.linkedContent: via Montaigne, law of secrecy placed above law of city, apolitical drive of friendship divides virtue or reason > double bind: 1) sovereign fraternity of secrecy btwn 2 w/out perjury 2) political secrecy of brotherhood begins w/ the 3rd, opens to perjury

MPM.content: fidelity requires that one quote, let other speak, and that one not restrict oneself to quoting > double law of Mnemosyne or common law of double source Mnemosyne/Lethe
MPM.linkedContent: fidelity requires that one quote, let other speak, and that one not restrict oneself to quoting > double law of Mnemosyne or common law of double source Mnemosyne/Lethe

MSUBJ.content: neither/nor of subjectile (neither subservient nor dominating) situates place of a double constraint (both screen & projectile) > becomes unrepresentable
MSUBJ.linkedContent: neither/nor of subjectile (neither subservient nor dominating) situates place of a double constraint (both screen & projectile) > becomes unrepresentable

A.content: [Derrida quickly reviews many places in his own work where he studied aporetology, paradoxical limitrophy, double bind]
A.linkedContent: [Derrida quickly reviews many places in his own work where he studied aporetology, paradoxical limitrophy, double bind]

A.content: decision concerns choice btwn relation w/ a wholly non-opposable other (an other that’s not its other) and an other who is its other (can be opposed in a couple) > the former relation is that of aporia, not a crossing of border but a double concept of the border
A.linkedContent: decision concerns choice btwn relation w/ a wholly non-opposable other (an other that’s not its other) and an other who is its other (can be opposed in a couple) > the former relation is that of aporia, not a crossing of border but a double concept of the border

SEC.content: deconstruction overturns (renversement), displaces, by means of double writing, double science, double gesture; field of oppositions that it criticizes [sic] can also be nondiscursive
SEC.linkedContent: deconstruction overturns (renversement), displaces, by means of double writing, double science, double gesture; field of oppositions that it criticizes [sic] can also be nondiscursive

SEC.content: logic of paleonymy, provisional conservation of old name, while liberating, “grafting,” excluded, subordinated predicates (resistances, remainders of dominant force)
SEC.linkedContent: logic of paleonymy, provisional conservation of old name, while liberating, “grafting,” excluded, subordinated predicates (resistances, remainders of dominant force)

OH.content: double bind, injunction divides us > guardians of a European idea that cares for what is other than it, the other heading, the heading of the other
OH.linkedContent: double bind, injunction divides us > guardians of a European idea that cares for what is other than it, the other heading, the heading of the other

OH.content: double injunction of Europe: 1) cannot be dispersed (monopoly) 2) remote control [TV] (dispersion)
OH.linkedContent: double injunction of Europe: 1) cannot be dispersed (monopoly) 2) remote control [TV] (dispersion)

OH.content: ethics, politics, responsibility only begin in aporia of double injunction

double bind of European cultural identity: 1) necessary not to reconstitute centralizing hegemony (the capital) 2) necessary not to cultivate minority differences for their sake, untranslatable idiolects (not to multiply borders, marges, marches)
OH.linkedContent: double bind of European cultural identity: 1) necessary not to reconstitute centralizing hegemony (the capital) 2) necessary not to cultivate minority differences for their sake, untranslatable idiolects (not to multiply borders, marges, marches)

OH.content: alliance of capital and a-capital (the other of capital): this seems impossible, it is, such is the nature of all responsibility
OH.linkedContent: alliance of capital and a-capital (the other of capital): this seems impossible, it is, such is the nature of all responsibility

OH.content: the duty to respond to call of European memory, all other duties presuppose this one in silence [?]
OH.linkedContent: the duty to respond to call of European memory, all other duties presuppose this one in silence [?]

OH.content: duty to act in accord w/ a double contradiction that is not simply a Kantian illusionary antimony but an effective one (w/ experience, through experiment), interminable
OH.linkedContent: duty to act in accord w/ a double contradiction that is not simply a Kantian illusionary antimony but an effective one (w/ experience, through experiment), interminable

OH.content: double constraint, performative contradiction, undecidable (typical, recurring form & inexhaustible singularization) > conditions for duty can only take negative form, once you hear “these are the conditions,” you are being deluded
OH.linkedContent: double constraint, performative contradiction, undecidable (typical, recurring form & inexhaustible singularization) > conditions for duty can only take negative form, once you hear “these are the conditions,” you are being deluded

PAS.content: bivalence of contraband or double bind (of near and far), affects everything that “is,” that is present, that arrives, comes to pass, the essence of the event and event of essence
PAS.linkedContent: bivalence of contraband or double bind (of near and far), affects everything that “is,” that is present, that arrives, comes to pass, the essence of the event and event of essence

PAS.content: logic of double band arrests laughter and shamelessness (l’impudeur) when they shield themselves (se défendent) against anguish and affirmation > contamination btwn laughs and violations is inevitable
PAS.linkedContent: logic of double band arrests laughter and shamelessness (l’impudeur) when they shield themselves (se défendent) against anguish and affirmation > contamination btwn laughs and violations is inevitable

PAS.content: double band is structure of name said to be proper, anonymity is the effect, whether by monumentalization (sauf, the unscathed) or effacement (seeds, dispersion); gift of name is corrupted in advance dans le pas-de-nom [plus-de-nom] > what takes place in and beyond language: leaves the fold of this folding back
PAS.linkedContent: double band is structure of name said to be proper, anonymity is the effect, whether by monumentalization (sauf, the unscathed) or effacement (seeds, dispersion); gift of name is corrupted in advance dans le pas-de-nom [plus-de-nom] > what takes place in and beyond language: leaves the fold of this folding back

T.content: vanne ouverte à une double entente ne formant plus un seul système
T.linkedContent: vanne ouverte à une double entente ne formant plus un seul système

FWT.content: heir must respond to double injunction: reaffirm what comes “before us,” necessary (il faut) to appropriate a past fundamentally inappropriable, reaffirm, relaunch otherwise, keep alive
FWT.linkedContent: heir must respond to double injunction: reaffirm what comes “before us,” necessary (il faut) to appropriate a past fundamentally inappropriable, reaffirm, relaunch otherwise, keep alive

FWT.content: reaffirmation which continues & interrupts: one’s own decision as that of the other: signature against signature
FWT.linkedContent: reaffirmation which continues & interrupts: one’s own decision as that of the other: signature against signature

FWT.content: contradictory/uncomfortable double injunction: mad for an absolute past, past whose (im)measure that of bottomless memory, while dreading nostalgia, fixation, cult of remembrance: nothing seems desirable save in this injunction > leave life in life & make it live again [this “heir]
FWT.linkedContent: contradictory/uncomfortable double injunction: mad for an absolute past, past whose (im)measure that of bottomless memory, while dreading nostalgia, fixation, cult of remembrance: nothing seems desirable save in this injunction > leave life in life & make it live again [this “heir]

FWT.content: heritage not only a double injunction or reaffirmation but a choice, filtering, heir not only receives but is one who risks choosing
FWT.linkedContent: heritage not only a double injunction or reaffirmation but a choice, filtering, heir not only receives but is one who risks choosing

FWT.content: risk decision by enduring undecidable: 2 contradictory imperatives

double bind: must not give ground on either legitimate  injunction, no decision, no responsibility worthy of the name that doesn’t endure this double injunction, this terrible law, the law of the law, which gives responsibility a chance, leaving no chance for good conscience [see 223n double bind a word coined to describe schizophrenic]
FWT.linkedContent: double bind: must not give ground on either legitimate injunction, no decision, no responsibility worthy of the name that doesn’t endure this double injunction, this terrible law, the law of the law, which gives responsibility a chance, leaving no chance for good conscience [see 223n double bind a word coined to describe schizophrenic]

P.content: sublime does violence to our imagination, all the more sublime for that, shock, double bind (attraction, repulsion), violent incommensurability
P.linkedContent: sublime does violence to our imagination, all the more sublime for that, shock, double bind (attraction, repulsion), violent incommensurability

POS.content: Derrida’s “books" are entirely consumed by reading of other texts, while also referring only to its own writing: we must conceive these contradictory ideas together [deconstruction of book]
POS.linkedContent: Derrida’s “books" are entirely consumed by reading of other texts, while also referring only to its own writing: we must conceive these contradictory ideas together [deconstruction of book]

ROP.content: resistance [to analysis] as double bind, other or outside at heart of internal auto-affective tension > it provokes analysis and dialectic to infinity, in order to resist both absolutely
ROP.linkedContent: resistance [to analysis] as double bind, other or outside at heart of internal auto-affective tension > it provokes analysis and dialectic to infinity, in order to resist both absolutely

ROP.content: deconstruction announces status w/out status of nonfinite # of names/quasi-concepts: the thinking of writing called for this, but it’s better thematized and formalized in theory of double bind, stricture of double band, and especially non-ontological remaining ——double bind drives deconstruction in rhythmic compulsion to track desire for origin, and to raise its stakes, la pousse à une surenchère > interminable drama of analysis, il fallait faire droit to the law deconstructed, w/ une affirmation donatrice unknown to yet driving analysis
ROP.linkedContent: deconstruction announces status w/out status of nonfinite # of names/quasi-concepts: the thinking of writing called for this, but it’s better thematized and formalized in theory of double bind, stricture of double band, and especially non-ontological remaining ——double bind drives deconstruction in rhythmic compulsion to track desire for origin, and to raise its stakes, la pousse à une surenchère > interminable drama of analysis, il fallait faire droit to the law deconstructed, w/ une affirmation donatrice unknown to yet driving analysis

ROP.content: double bind at work on examples of all undecidable figures (hymen, pharmakon…), carry predicates incompatible btwn themselves, in their very btwn, interlacing, sumplukē, chiasmatic invagination > but each one, in its sumplukē, makes up a single trace [?]
ROP.linkedContent: double bind at work on examples of all undecidable figures (hymen, pharmakon…), carry predicates incompatible btwn themselves, in their very btwn, interlacing, sumplukē, chiasmatic invagination > but each one, in its sumplukē, makes up a single trace [?]

ROP.content: iterability as condition/constitution of identity, ideality, of all concepts, but also (double bind) that which resists hierarchical and binary oppositions, a quasi-concept, inconceivable concept > not confusion, approximation, but “reaffirmed exigency of analysis”
ROP.linkedContent: iterability as condition/constitution of identity, ideality, of all concepts, but also (double bind) that which resists hierarchical and binary oppositions, a quasi-concept, inconceivable concept > not confusion, approximation, but “reaffirmed exigency of analysis”

ROP.content: Glas and The Post Card, books on bind (Band), nexum, desmos, stricture, “unsolvable-postal effect”
ROP.linkedContent: Glas and The Post Card, books on bind (Band), nexum, desmos, stricture, “unsolvable-postal effect”

ROP.content: “deconstruction's” double bind: 1) inherit from Enlightenment, affirmed/displaced in Freud, Husserl, & even Heidegger 2) tirelessly analyze resistance that clings to the elementary
ROP.linkedContent: “deconstruction's” double bind: 1) inherit from Enlightenment, affirmed/displaced in Freud, Husserl, & even Heidegger 2) tirelessly analyze resistance that clings to the elementary

ROP.content: law of antinomy, can only be endured in its tension (Kant’s antinomies the fated outcome of analysis), paradox of a double “one must”: one can only endure the double bind in passion
ROP.linkedContent: law of antinomy, can only be endured in its tension (Kant’s antinomies the fated outcome of analysis), paradox of a double “one must”: one can only endure the double bind in passion

ROP.content: double bind (preferable to double contrainte), is the call to analysis: one can never fully analyze it, one can only unbind one of its knots by making the other tighter: movement I call stricture
ROP.linkedContent: double bind (preferable to double contrainte), is the call to analysis: one can never fully analyze it, one can only unbind one of its knots by making the other tighter: movement I call stricture

ROP.content: sans ce double bind et sans l'épreuve de l'aporie qu'il détermine, w/out its thousands and thousands of knots of passion, all would be program, no event/decision/place would ever take place (double bind can be “pathological,” but no more than pathetic figures of death)
ROP.linkedContent: sans ce double bind et sans l'épreuve de l'aporie qu'il détermine, w/out its thousands and thousands of knots of passion, all would be program, no event/decision/place would ever take place (double bind can be “pathological,” but no more than pathetic figures of death)

OTO.content: Nietzsche’s living mother/dead father, identity as double & neutral; “I know both, I am both” [“both” must be read as singular] > la vie la mort: the dead man the living feminine
OTO.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s living mother/dead father, identity as double & neutral; “I know both, I am both” [“both” must be read as singular] > la vie la mort: the dead man the living feminine

ATIA.content: je rêve, donc, au fond d’un terrier introuvable et à venir: the schizis of a contradictory injunction > translate an inhuman language w/out the usual bêtise re: animal
ATIA.linkedContent: je rêve, donc, au fond d’un terrier introuvable et à venir: the schizis of a contradictory injunction > translate an inhuman language w/out the usual bêtise re: animal

O.content: [summary] must face risk of “old name,” not simply declare freedom of signifier (autonomy of meaning) or go outside (which affirms homogeny of closure, which doesn’t exist) > double mark (1 mark in/1 mark out deconstructed system), double reading, double science: no concept, no name, no signifier can escape this structure
O.linkedContent: [summary] must face risk of “old name,” not simply declare freedom of signifier (autonomy of meaning) or go outside (which affirms homogeny of closure, which doesn’t exist) > double mark (1 mark in/1 mark out deconstructed system), double reading, double science: no concept, no name, no signifier can escape this structure

WAP.content: fidelity to an absolute quasi-contract w/ no history: not irresponsibility, but more imperative one, right not to have to appear before (account to) this or that regime (of appearing)
WAP.linkedContent: fidelity to an absolute quasi-contract w/ no history: not irresponsibility, but more imperative one, right not to have to appear before (account to) this or that regime (of appearing)

WAP.content: double bind of philosophical commitment or pledge (droit, if a philosopheme, also submitted to law of double bind: unstable, deconstructible, it precedes itself, calls for indestructible responsibility)
WAP.linkedContent: double bind of philosophical commitment or pledge (droit, if a philosopheme, also submitted to law of double bind: unstable, deconstructible, it precedes itself, calls for indestructible responsibility)

WAP.content: double bind of techno-science (formalization)/philosophy (mother/natural tongue): 1) formalization of techno-science resists monolingual hegemony of philosophy as onto-encylopedia—science of sciences 2) philosophy can still point to dogmatic philosophemes in science
WAP.linkedContent: double bind of techno-science (formalization)/philosophy (mother/natural tongue): 1) formalization of techno-science resists monolingual hegemony of philosophy as onto-encylopedia—science of sciences 2) philosophy can still point to dogmatic philosophemes in science

WAP.content: ingenuity of human sciences (precritical) offers privileged ground for ideological reinvestments > double bind, the nodosité (knottiness) of the knot structure: precriticalness is often of a philosophical nature—and where is the State in all this?
WAP.linkedContent: ingenuity of human sciences (precritical) offers privileged ground for ideological reinvestments > double bind, the nodosité (knottiness) of the knot structure: precriticalness is often of a philosophical nature—and where is the State in all this?

SW.content: the 2 categorical imperatives of tallith/prayer: don’t be late, must be living skin: untenability of these imperatives the very possibility of the promise
SW.linkedContent: the 2 categorical imperatives of tallith/prayer: don’t be late, must be living skin: untenability of these imperatives the very possibility of the promise

TB.content: every translator is committed, committed by the other before having committed himself?
TB.linkedContent: every translator is committed, committed by the other before having committed himself?

TB.content: if original text demands translation, the original is indebted to the translator, original is 1st debtor: God weeps over his untranslatable name > [his Law as law of translation]
TB.linkedContent: if original text demands translation, the original is indebted to the translator, original is 1st debtor: God weeps over his untranslatable name > [his Law as law of translation]

TB.content: double bind is the law, in name of God: most originary, most sacred, must be translated, deciphered: translation not 2nd (secondary): constructor cannot make universal tongue, deconstructor constrained by appeal to translation
TB.linkedContent: double bind is the law, in name of God: most originary, most sacred, must be translated, deciphered: translation not 2nd (secondary): constructor cannot make universal tongue, deconstructor constrained by appeal to translation

DPi.content: for Kant, justice finds itself here in double bind, knot: either honor (Ehrbegriff) is vain or DP should simply be set aside > Die Auflösung dieses Knotens: no more DP when law (CI) & nature align
DPi.linkedContent: for Kant, justice finds itself here in double bind, knot: either honor (Ehrbegriff) is vain or DP should simply be set aside > Die Auflösung dieses Knotens: no more DP when law (CI) & nature align

DPi.content: no more need to not DP women, they’ll never marry out of wedlock (Derrida adds: extraordinary & stupid uselessness, rigor & absurdity of Kant’s logic)
DPi.linkedContent: no more need to not DP women, they’ll never marry out of wedlock (Derrida adds: extraordinary & stupid uselessness, rigor & absurdity of Kant’s logic)

DPi.content: angel came announcing deconstruction of death, but deconstruction has more than one angel, the other warned against banalizing, relativizing DP like Christianity has done, using an alibi of beyond to deny irreversible gravity of death [returns to angels on pp. 253-54]
DPi.linkedContent: angel came announcing deconstruction of death, but deconstruction has more than one angel, the other warned against banalizing, relativizing DP like Christianity has done, using an alibi of beyond to deny irreversible gravity of death [returns to angels on pp. 253-54]

DPi.content: DP will survive (other figures will be invented for it) > still must militate against it
DPi.linkedContent: DP will survive (other figures will be invented for it) > still must militate against it

CHM.content: there are 2 ways to totally disengage totality of historical language: 1) stay silent about silence 2) follow madman down road of his exile [rabbit hole]
CHM.linkedContent: there are 2 ways to totally disengage totality of historical language: 1) stay silent about silence 2) follow madman down road of his exile [rabbit hole]

RGE.content: sovereignty, the putting at stake, the space of writing, absolute in night of secret: “continuum of sovereign communication has as its milieu this night of secret difference” > one would understand nothing if one thought there’s a contradiction btwn these 2 requisites
RGE.linkedContent: sovereignty, the putting at stake, the space of writing, absolute in night of secret: “continuum of sovereign communication has as its milieu this night of secret difference” > one would understand nothing if one thought there’s a contradiction btwn these 2 requisites

REST.content: logic of detachment as cut (opposition, leads to suturing-sublation, maintains problematic of castration truth) vs. logic of detachment as stricture (is tout autre, interlacing of differance of [or as] stricture, no suture, haunting, neither empty nor full, l’argument-de-la-gaine, can’t accommodate the couple, ces coupes oppositionelles, the ghost leases, le, la, les double(s) band-)
REST.linkedContent: logic of detachment as cut (opposition, leads to suturing-sublation, maintains problematic of castration truth) vs. logic of detachment as stricture (is tout autre, interlacing of differance of [or as] stricture, no suture, haunting, neither empty nor full, l’argument-de-la-gaine, can’t accommodate the couple, ces coupes oppositionelles, the ghost leases, le, la, les double(s) band-)

REST.content: [Derrida describes this logic of stricture as a double bind suspendu/tendu à la fois, but will not attach it strictly to another discourse on double bind] > any stricture is à la fois stricturation & destricturation
REST.linkedContent: [Derrida describes this logic of stricture as a double bind suspendu/tendu à la fois, but will not attach it strictly to another discourse on double bind] > any stricture is à la fois stricturation & destricturation

REST.content: the de-paired (le dépareillé), the disparate, helps us better to think the pair’s repair (à sa réparation), à panser (bandage), à bander là où le-la-les double(s) band- [cf. P p. 88]
REST.linkedContent: the de-paired (le dépareillé), the disparate, helps us better to think the pair’s repair (à sa réparation), à panser (bandage), à bander là où le-la-les double(s) band- [cf. P p. 88]

DST.content: tie thinking of untranslatable idiom to logic of double constraint: one must avoid avoiding, one cannot avoid avoiding, il faut, il ne faut pas
DST.linkedContent: tie thinking of untranslatable idiom to logic of double constraint: one must avoid avoiding, one cannot avoid avoiding, il faut, il ne faut pas

DST.content: question of obsession, of obsidionality, of exposure on all sides, arises w/ figure of a besieged (assiégée) power
DST.linkedContent: question of obsession, of obsidionality, of exposure on all sides, arises w/ figure of a besieged (assiégée) power

DST.content: this figure is impregnable because it has no single site, single figure
DST.linkedContent: this figure is impregnable because it has no single site, single figure

DST.content: it harasses (harcèle) out of (depuis) sa désistance all the others in turn ——traps everywhere, double bind and hyperbologic leave no way out (aucun issue)
DST.linkedContent: it harasses (harcèle) out of (depuis) sa désistance all the others in turn ——traps everywhere, double bind and hyperbologic leave no way out (aucun issue)

DST.content: must know all this to begin to think
DST.linkedContent: must know all this to begin to think

DST.content: double bind (as ending parentheses): can’t close one front w/out opening another on another side
DST.linkedContent: double bind (as ending parentheses): can’t close one front w/out opening another on another side

DST.content: thus Lacoue-Labarthe’s “style,” ethos, multiplying parentheses, rhythm of warnings, which don’t protect anyone > warning stands watch so no one will fail to expose oneself
DST.linkedContent: thus Lacoue-Labarthe’s “style,” ethos, multiplying parentheses, rhythm of warnings, which don’t protect anyone > warning stands watch so no one will fail to expose oneself

DST.content: à la fois (double bind) > point out & not point out (relever et ne pas relever)
DST.linkedContent: à la fois (double bind) > point out & not point out (relever et ne pas relever)

DST.content: désistance brings to light anoia, not to be confused w/ madness though it can resemble it > double bind btwn 2 madnesses: 1) one of disintalling 2) one of reason, defensive stiffening (crispation) in assistance [Kafka], imitation, identification > madness against madness
DST.linkedContent: désistance brings to light anoia, not to be confused w/ madness though it can resemble it > double bind btwn 2 madnesses: 1) one of disintalling 2) one of reason, defensive stiffening (crispation) in assistance [Kafka], imitation, identification > madness against madness

DST.content: [in reference to method found in Lacoue-Labarthe] supplementary loop (boucle), tempted to call it a ring (anneau), voire bague (band), a certain circulation takes on value of prescription: obligation, injunction, alliance > detour & return path > inside and outside path of epochality
DST.linkedContent: [in reference to method found in Lacoue-Labarthe] supplementary loop (boucle), tempted to call it a ring (anneau), voire bague (band), a certain circulation takes on value of prescription: obligation, injunction, alliance > detour & return path > inside and outside path of epochality

DST.content: Derrida says that no dialectic can overcome (ne saurait venir à bout) double constraint, double law, that of knot & caesura, obligation & cut (i.e. rhythm) > but then wonders if double bind is too dialectical, so he thinks of an arrythmic gap, hiatus, caesura, another undecidable
DST.linkedContent: Derrida says that no dialectic can overcome (ne saurait venir à bout) double constraint, double law, that of knot & caesura, obligation & cut (i.e. rhythm) > but then wonders if double bind is too dialectical, so he thinks of an arrythmic gap, hiatus, caesura, another undecidable

DST.content: un autre indécidable, the gap/hiatus in an undecidable derived from dialectical calculation/contraction, arrhythmic caesura as respiration of rhythm (this necessity awaits us) [pas, heartbeat] [Derrida here wonders if double bind is too dialectical, thus the other undecidable]
DST.linkedContent: un autre indécidable, the gap/hiatus in an undecidable derived from dialectical calculation/contraction, arrhythmic caesura as respiration of rhythm (this necessity awaits us) [pas, heartbeat] [Derrida here wonders if double bind is too dialectical, thus the other undecidable]

DST.content: no rhythm w/out caesura > antirhythmic [Hölderlin], arrhythmic
DST.linkedContent: no rhythm w/out caesura > antirhythmic [Hölderlin], arrhythmic

DST.content: interrupts alternation, constraint of opposition, even double bind [cf. p. 225]
DST.linkedContent: interrupts alternation, constraint of opposition, even double bind [cf. p. 225]

DST.content: Lacoue-Labarthe: caesura is empty moment, intrusion of prophetic word (Tiresias)
DST.linkedContent: Lacoue-Labarthe: caesura is empty moment, intrusion of prophetic word (Tiresias)

DST.content: caesura marks withdrawal of divine, plays at & undoes mourning > doubles work of mourning (the speculative, the dialectic, the opposition, the identification, the nostalgic interiorization, even the double bind of imitation), caesura takes one’s breath away (coupe le souffle), open mouth, pour donner, pour recevoir: quand elle a de la chance, gives one speech
DST.linkedContent: caesura marks withdrawal of divine, plays at & undoes mourning > doubles work of mourning (the speculative, the dialectic, the opposition, the identification, the nostalgic interiorization, even the double bind of imitation), caesura takes one’s breath away (coupe le souffle), open mouth, pour donner, pour recevoir: quand elle a de la chance, gives one speech

DST.content: unavoidable resistance to désistance as nonpathological inhibition, no rhythm w/out it, can say the same about the double bind (see p. 228 return to father, subject to law as inhibition, defense) [a safeguarding, a filiation, a subjectivity compelled by the caesura?]
DST.linkedContent: unavoidable resistance to désistance as nonpathological inhibition, no rhythm w/out it, can say the same about the double bind (see p. 228 return to father, subject to law as inhibition, defense) [a safeguarding, a filiation, a subjectivity compelled by the caesura?]

PIO.content: singularity of event that produces itself by speaking about itself [Derrida’s essay], invents on subject of invention, bringing it about—while also describing generality of its genre, genealogy of its topos, sustaining tradition de inventione
PIO.linkedContent: singularity of event that produces itself by speaking about itself [Derrida’s essay], invents on subject of invention, bringing it about—while also describing generality of its genre, genealogy of its topos, sustaining tradition de inventione

PIO.content: invention only by recourse to lexicon, syntactical rules, prevailing code—a certain submission to conventions (a given configuration)
PIO.linkedContent: invention only by recourse to lexicon, syntactical rules, prevailing code—a certain submission to conventions (a given configuration)

PIO.content: the double, indivisible movement of invention: gives place (donne lieu) to an event and produces a machine by introducing a gap (écart) in habit; the “coming,” the venire, the event of novelty must surprise: no status ready/waiting to reduce it to the same
PIO.linkedContent: the double, indivisible movement of invention: gives place (donne lieu) to an event and produces a machine by introducing a gap (écart) in habit; the “coming,” the venire, the event of novelty must surprise: no status ready/waiting to reduce it to the same

TR.content: band, ribbon, silk, double bind en soie, ringhband, phantasmatic body on which limited ink (finite reserve) is made to flow; ink remains modest but capitalizes, virtually lets flow
TR.linkedContent: band, ribbon, silk, double bind en soie, ringhband, phantasmatic body on which limited ink (finite reserve) is made to flow; ink remains modest but capitalizes, virtually lets flow

TR.content: ribbon: subjectile on which one writes & piece of machine thanks to which one will never have done w/ inscribing [all this deconstructs de Man’s claim the “ribbon” is a “free signifier’]
TR.linkedContent: ribbon: subjectile on which one writes & piece of machine thanks to which one will never have done w/ inscribing [all this deconstructs de Man’s claim the “ribbon” is a “free signifier’]

+R.content: Ich [the painting, but…] can’t be found in Glas; Ich captures/draws to itself a psicultural machination rhythmed by logic of double band (bind) or so-called sheath argument
+R.linkedContent: Ich [the painting, but…] can’t be found in Glas; Ich captures/draws to itself a psicultural machination rhythmed by logic of double band (bind) or so-called sheath argument

C.content: [re: out-of-series] dynamic instability or even double bind (holds coffin btwn its laces): both colossal/radiating/magnificent & diminished/abandoned (délaissé), delacée
C.linkedContent: [re: out-of-series] dynamic instability or even double bind (holds coffin btwn its laces): both colossal/radiating/magnificent & diminished/abandoned (délaissé), delacée

C.content: a discourse on stricture: elles sont tendues pour (faire) bander le mors (bind the bit, get a hard-on), set a trap w/key and lock (serrure) > get up the ghost of a double bind, same lacing in other series, w/in, around two bodies skewered in mirror-image
C.linkedContent: a discourse on stricture: elles sont tendues pour (faire) bander le mors (bind the bit, get a hard-on), set a trap w/key and lock (serrure) > get up the ghost of a double bind, same lacing in other series, w/in, around two bodies skewered in mirror-image

LI.content: undecidability (not “indeterminacy”) always a determinate oscillation btwn possibilities highly determined in strictly defined structures: difference of force in decision of writing (a word whose broad sense includes political action & experience in general) > no indecision or double bind w/out determination: occasionally, each side terribly necessary & irreplaceably singular
LI.linkedContent: undecidability (not “indeterminacy”) always a determinate oscillation btwn possibilities highly determined in strictly defined structures: difference of force in decision of writing (a word whose broad sense includes political action & experience in general) > no indecision or double bind w/out determination: occasionally, each side terribly necessary & irreplaceably singular

LI.content: “double writing”: irreducible divisibility, “quasi-transcendental,” must partition itself along 2 sides of a limit and respect the rules (to certain extent) of what it deconstructs
LI.linkedContent: “double writing”: irreducible divisibility, “quasi-transcendental,” must partition itself along 2 sides of a limit and respect the rules (to certain extent) of what it deconstructs

LI.content: without this tension, contradiction, could anything be done? change?
LI.linkedContent: without this tension, contradiction, could anything be done? change?

TN.content: penser le toucher en touchant à l’intouchable > injunction of impossible?
TN.linkedContent: penser le toucher en touchant à l’intouchable > injunction of impossible?

AD.content: violence of pure face to face (hospitable welcome, narcissistic closing [renfermement]): in double bind [not a term Levinas would use] w/ the 3rd (protects against vertigo of ethical violence while violating its purity)
AD.linkedContent: violence of pure face to face (hospitable welcome, narcissistic closing [renfermement]): in double bind [not a term Levinas would use] w/ the 3rd (protects against vertigo of ethical violence while violating its purity)

AD.content: justice as law begins w/ perjury > violates; sigh of just man: “Qu’ai-je à faire avec la justice?”
AD.linkedContent: justice as law begins w/ perjury > violates; sigh of just man: “Qu’ai-je à faire avec la justice?”

CF.content: inherit a heritage w/ a double & contradictory injunction: reinvent memory w/out norm or criteria
CF.linkedContent: inherit a heritage w/ a double & contradictory injunction: reinvent memory w/out norm or criteria

BSi.content: double bind of being inside or outside of marriage (inside/outside cage), double bind of domestication, regret on both sides
BSi.linkedContent: double bind of being inside or outside of marriage (inside/outside cage), double bind of domestication, regret on both sides

BSi.content: liberty & sovereignty (its limitless “I can”) are indissociable, double bind in 2 senses: 1) double injunction 2) duplicity in very concept of binding, obligation, bind, bond: stricture rather than structure, stricture that limits liberty along w/ sovereignty or sovereignty along w/ liberty
BSi.linkedContent: liberty & sovereignty (its limitless “I can”) are indissociable, double bind in 2 senses: 1) double injunction 2) duplicity in very concept of binding, obligation, bind, bond: stricture rather than structure, stricture that limits liberty along w/ sovereignty or sovereignty along w/ liberty

BSi.content: double bind [#1 above]: deconstruct ontotheology of sovereignty w/out questioning liberty in name of which we put this deconstruction to work: think liberty differently, w/in distribution of a divisible sovereignty > think unconditional w/out indivisible sovereignty
BSi.linkedContent: double bind [#1 above]: deconstruct ontotheology of sovereignty w/out questioning liberty in name of which we put this deconstruction to work: think liberty differently, w/in distribution of a divisible sovereignty > think unconditional w/out indivisible sovereignty

BSi.content: if double bind (implacable contradiction) ever lifted (that’s impossible, how could anyone wish for it?) > paradise; can only dream of paradise (absolute felicity and inescapable catastrophe)
BSi.linkedContent: if double bind (implacable contradiction) ever lifted (that’s impossible, how could anyone wish for it?) > paradise; can only dream of paradise (absolute felicity and inescapable catastrophe)

OG.content: Pierce’s sign w/ no final reference comes close to deconstruction, he complies w/ 2 incompatible exigencies w/out sacrificing one for the other > links symbol & sign, semiotics & logic: to think only in signs, is to ruin the notion of sign > the thing itself is a sign
OG.linkedContent: Pierce’s sign w/ no final reference comes close to deconstruction, he complies w/ 2 incompatible exigencies w/out sacrificing one for the other > links symbol & sign, semiotics & logic: to think only in signs, is to ruin the notion of sign > the thing itself is a sign

OG.content: [review of Rousseau] voice immediacy, hieroglyphic immediacy, in and out of nature: [double bind of] need & passion, Rousseau describes une différance supplémentaire [writing/pity]
OG.linkedContent: [review of Rousseau] voice immediacy, hieroglyphic immediacy, in and out of nature: [double bind of] need & passion, Rousseau describes une différance supplémentaire [writing/pity]

OG.content: [excluded 3rd defied by supplement] incompatibles brought together [Freud’s dream interpretation] [double bind]: Rousseau affirms both that which constructs via articulation (passion, language, society, man) & that which is canceled by it (accent, life, energy, passion) [passion both prior to supplement & supplemental] > Rousseau dissociates these contradictions while allowing an intact purity (une pureté inentameé) to both negative & positive
OG.linkedContent: [excluded 3rd defied by supplement] incompatibles brought together [Freud’s dream interpretation] [double bind]: Rousseau affirms both that which constructs via articulation (passion, language, society, man) & that which is canceled by it (accent, life, energy, passion) [passion both prior to supplement & supplemental] > Rousseau dissociates these contradictions while allowing an intact purity (une pureté inentameé) to both negative & positive

OG.content: Rousseau says what he doesn’t wish to say: graphics of supplementarity is not comprised in any dialectic (a concept governed by horizon of presence, eschatological parousia, parole pleine)
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau says what he doesn’t wish to say: graphics of supplementarity is not comprised in any dialectic (a concept governed by horizon of presence, eschatological parousia, parole pleine)

ATAP.content: grace when writing of other absolves you from double bind, gift unbinds itself from double bind > grace can never be proven, improbable: belief itself
ATAP.linkedContent: grace when writing of other absolves you from double bind, gift unbinds itself from double bind > grace can never be proven, improbable: belief itself

ATAP.content: John Patmos’ double bind: “do not seal the words of the inspiration of this book” > must disobey in order to obey: problem of translation re: quotation marks (“I, Yéshoua”)
ATAP.linkedContent: John Patmos’ double bind: “do not seal the words of the inspiration of this book” > must disobey in order to obey: problem of translation re: quotation marks (“I, Yéshoua”)

CIR.content: “I promised to God never to write anything more except on the most irrepressible of drives, the double condition” [double bind]
CIR.linkedContent: “I promised to God never to write anything more except on the most irrepressible of drives, the double condition” [double bind]

CIR.content: word Sony reminds me of the dream in Turin, btwn Rousseau/Nietzsche > my two positive heroes
CIR.linkedContent: word Sony reminds me of the dream in Turin, btwn Rousseau/Nietzsche > my two positive heroes

CIR.content: day of circumcision: a de-cision was taken in me w/out me > Jealousy & virginity, my two nipples
CIR.linkedContent: day of circumcision: a de-cision was taken in me w/out me > Jealousy & virginity, my two nipples

CIR.content: in all the history of humanity, have never known anyone happier, luckier, more euphoric than I (isn’t this a priori true?) > and yet [double bind] remained counterexample of myself: sad, deprived, neurotic, jealous, disappointed
CIR.linkedContent: in all the history of humanity, have never known anyone happier, luckier, more euphoric than I (isn’t this a priori true?) > and yet [double bind] remained counterexample of myself: sad, deprived, neurotic, jealous, disappointed

CIR.content: can’t write w/out these two certainties > interest as passionate as it is disillusioned w/ language, literature, philosophy > impossibility to say: “I sign”
CIR.linkedContent: can’t write w/out these two certainties > interest as passionate as it is disillusioned w/ language, literature, philosophy > impossibility to say: “I sign”

CIR.content: Derrida as favorite son: excluded and favorite, at two juxtaposed moments [double bind]
CIR.linkedContent: Derrida as favorite son: excluded and favorite, at two juxtaposed moments [double bind]

EU.content: violence comes from both sides, each term of opposition marked by other side (not simply passage btwn 2 poles): law/nonlaw, writing/speech, death/life, paternal/maternal language): always 2 forces of frayage and resistance: each bearing life/death at once
EU.linkedContent: violence comes from both sides, each term of opposition marked by other side (not simply passage btwn 2 poles): law/nonlaw, writing/speech, death/life, paternal/maternal language): always 2 forces of frayage and resistance: each bearing life/death at once

EU.content: double bind that knots around sublime body of “teacher of philosophizing” [i.e. philosophy eludes teaching, philosophizing requires it]: teacher haunts the scene, doesn’t dominate, or dominates like a ghost > one might say he fascinates/seduces if these connotations weren’t too closely tied to imagination/sensibility: for reason should break the charm [of sensibility?]
EU.linkedContent: double bind that knots around sublime body of “teacher of philosophizing” [i.e. philosophy eludes teaching, philosophizing requires it]: teacher haunts the scene, doesn’t dominate, or dominates like a ghost > one might say he fascinates/seduces if these connotations weren’t too closely tied to imagination/sensibility: for reason should break the charm [of sensibility?]

EU.content: interpretation of poem, philosopheme, theologeme always proposes an institutional model, consolidating an existing one or constituting a new one: calls for politics of community of interpreters > every text/element of corpus bequeathes/reproduces several injunctions
EU.linkedContent: interpretation of poem, philosopheme, theologeme always proposes an institutional model, consolidating an existing one or constituting a new one: calls for politics of community of interpreters > every text/element of corpus bequeathes/reproduces several injunctions

EU.content: every text opens/closes, double bind, undecidability, an overdetermination that can’t be mastered
EU.linkedContent: every text opens/closes, double bind, undecidability, an overdetermination that can’t be mastered

EU.content: [structure of matrix of philosophical discipline] is a “nondialectizable” contradiction, divided law, double law, double bind, antinomy: the fights/debates we’re talking about always oppose different philosophies
EU.linkedContent: [structure of matrix of philosophical discipline] is a “nondialectizable” contradiction, divided law, double law, double bind, antinomy: the fights/debates we’re talking about always oppose different philosophies

EU.content: Husserl’s transcendental community of “we” in face of “crisis” & Heidegger’s call of Being comprises, pre-comprehends, us—so we begin w/ them & otherwise: 1st commandment: 2 ends: the cheap end, the Kantian end 2nd commandment: local, ubiquity 3rd commandment: teach, not teach 6th commandment: time requirements, and “single blow (tout à coup)” 7th commandment: place, non-place
EU.linkedContent: Husserl’s transcendental community of “we” in face of “crisis” & Heidegger’s call of Being comprises, pre-comprehends, us—so we begin w/ them & otherwise: 1st commandment: 2 ends: the cheap end, the Kantian end 2nd commandment: local, ubiquity 3rd commandment: teach, not teach 6th commandment: time requirements, and “single blow (tout à coup)” 7th commandment: place, non-place

EU.content: only livable community (for Derrida, this is a faith in spirit of philosophy w/out dogma, murder, idiotic polemic, hateful distortion) wouldn’t shun/deny double law [i.e. a teacher must initiate/train a student while effacing him/herself in name of autodidactic tradition]
EU.linkedContent: only livable community (for Derrida, this is a faith in spirit of philosophy w/out dogma, murder, idiotic polemic, hateful distortion) wouldn’t shun/deny double law [i.e. a teacher must initiate/train a student while effacing him/herself in name of autodidactic tradition]

SPEC.content: when Manu is absolved of Varuna’s double bind by Indra, will Manu escape bind of profit (bénéfice) from Indra’s grace, will he only love Indra?
SPEC.linkedContent: when Manu is absolved of Varuna’s double bind by Indra, will Manu escape bind of profit (bénéfice) from Indra’s grace, will he only love Indra?

SPEC.content: to account/read the athetic, Derrida unsatisfied w/ dérive (drifting), too continuous/homogenous movement, travels away w/out saccade > prefers double bind, des effondrements de bord, la rive se partage en son trait même
SPEC.linkedContent: to account/read the athetic, Derrida unsatisfied w/ dérive (drifting), too continuous/homogenous movement, travels away w/out saccade > prefers double bind, des effondrements de bord, la rive se partage en son trait même

SPEC.content: [re: repetition before PP or collaborates w/ PP] the 2 repetitions (2 logics) as constitutive duplicity, double bind
SPEC.linkedContent: [re: repetition before PP or collaborates w/ PP] the 2 repetitions (2 logics) as constitutive duplicity, double bind

SPEC.content: if there’s any chance of reading illegible text as illegible: must take incalculable double bind (bande) of PP into account
SPEC.linkedContent: if there’s any chance of reading illegible text as illegible: must take incalculable double bind (bande) of PP into account
